name: Tetanus-Free Newborns
title: Newborns Safeguarded Against Tetanus
description: In 2023, 100% of newborns in the Bahamas were protected against tetanus, showcasing the country's commitment to maternal and child health.

name: Youth Employment Champions
title: High Youth Employment Rates
description: The Bahamas boasts an impressive youth employment rate of 79.6% in 2023, with females slightly ahead at 81.2%, reflecting robust opportunities for young people.

name: Active Workforce Nation
title: High Labor Force Participation
description: In 2023, the Bahamas had a total labor force participation rate of 97.7%, with females participating at 98.7% and males at 96.8%, indicating a highly active workforce.

name: Educated Workforce
title: Advanced Education in Labor Force
description: In 2023, 98.8% of the Bahamas' working-age population had advanced education, with females at 99.0% and males at 98.3%, highlighting a highly educated workforce.

name: Tariff Titans
title: High Tariff Rates on Manufactured Goods
description: In 2022, the Bahamas applied a simple mean tariff rate of 27.9% on manufactured products, with a most favored nation rate of 33.2%, indicating significant trade barriers.

name: Trade Barriers Alert
title: High Tariff Rates on All Products
description: In 2022, the Bahamas had a simple mean tariff rate of 26.3% on all products, with a most favored nation rate of 31.5%, suggesting a protective trade policy.

name: Clean Energy Champions
title: Lowest Carbon Emissions from Energy
description: In 2023, the Bahamas recorded one of the lowest carbon dioxide emissions from fugitive emissions in the energy sector, with a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e. This positions the Bahamas as a leader in clean energy practices.

name: Youth Health Challenge
title: Children Living with HIV
description: As of 2022, there were 100 children aged 0-14 living with HIV in the Bahamas. This highlights a critical area for health interventions and support.
